intro: Erigeron hessii, commonly known as the Sierra daisy, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other composite flowers. The plant features slender stems and small, white to pale blue ray florets surrounding yellow disk flowers. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to full sun. Erigeron hessii is often found in meadows and open woodlands at higher elevations.
